item.description:
This event is organized by CT Health Foodies, a supportive, dynamic community for people interested in healthy eating. We are a diverse group. People follow all different types of diets: gluten-free, vegetarian, omnivore, raw food, Ayurvedic, Weston A. Price. We respect everyone's choices.

We organize monthly potluck dinners and talks on the second Tuesday of the month at ArtSpace in downtown Hartford.

This month's speaker, Laura King, supervises a wellness team at Aetna Insurance.  Laura King’s passion is the health and wellness of her family, community and earth. She studied dietetics as an undergraduate and then got a Master's degree in Public Health with an emphasis on community health education. During graduate school, she worked as a pediatric nutritionist in New Haven. She is an avid cook, who tries to use as much local, fresh, seasonal products as possible.

Laura will be talking about small changes you can make to the dishes you prepare that will make a huge difference to your health.  We hope you will join the discussion and tell us about healthy foods that you love to make!

***************************************

Schedule for the evening:

7:15 pm: Delicious Potluck Dinner begins.

7:45 - 9:00 pm: Talk and Discussion

9:00 pm - 9:30 on: Hanging out and clean up

About the potluck dinner:

-Many people have dietary restrictions. Be mindful as you prepare your dish, and list the ingredients on a note card at the event.

-This a zero-waste event. Please bring your own plate and utensils.

***************************************

FREE PARKING! In the back of the ArtSpace building. Ignore "Resident Parking Only" signs. Parking is allowed during this event. Enter through the back entrance by the murals.

***************************************
item.how_to_find_us: Enter through the back entrance by the murals. Walk down the long corridor. At the end of the corridor, on the right, you will see the room where we will be meeting.
item.name: Potluck Dinner, Talk and Discussion about "Small Steps to Healthier Cooking"
